data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: To make a continuous low-pitched buzzing or humming sound.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: I heard a plane zooming overhead.

data.text: To move while making such a sound.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: couldn't hear as the motorcycle zoomed past.

data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: Stock prices zoomed in early trading.

data.text: To act or proceed swiftly and energetically.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
examples: zoomed through the novel in a day.

data.text: To simulate movement rapidly away from or toward a subject using a zoom lens or other optical device.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: To cause text or other graphics in a window or frame to appear larger on the screen.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The act or sound of zooming.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.
